text.text_translated: Researchers now have more questions about the influence of genetics (the study of genes and how traits pass from parents to children) on brain and language development, and one key question is whether a certain gene mutation (a change in a gene’s DNA) gave us the ability to speak. They have found a gene mutation that happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to help our brains control our mouth and face when we speak. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation, which may explain why they cannot speak like us. Although it is still too early to say how much influence genetics has on language, one day we might find the answers hidden in our DNA.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Genetics is the study of how traits pass from parents to children.  
A mutation is a change in DNA.  
Researchers want to know if genetics helped our brains and our ability to speak to develop.  
They have found a mutation that happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago.  
It seems to affect how we speak and how our brains control our mouths and faces.  
Monkeys have a similar part of DNA.  
But this part did not have the mutation.  
That is why they cannot speak like us.  
It is still too early to know how much genetics influence language.  
Maybe one day the answers will be in our DNA.
